item.title: Report X-2023121122
item.description:
Report X-2023121122

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP, BY THE RESPONDER FROM THE OUTBOUND WALL. IN THE DMP, PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE, 1 GALLON, PLASTIC BOTTLE OF LIQUICLEAN MCT113, BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT SHIPPMENT, (UN3265, CORROSIVE LIQUID, ACIDIC, ORGANIC, N.O.S.,(FORMIC ACID, HYDROXYACETIC ACID), 8, II, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX 1 GALLON). THE CAP ON THE GALLON JUG WAS LOOSE, WHICH ALLOWED A LARGE PORTION OF THE ACID TO ESCAPE ON THE FLOOR, NEAR THE LOCATION OF THE TRUCK. ALL ACID WAS ABSORBED AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ACCORDING TO REGULATIONS.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 21, 2023, six (6) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GMES) to remediate the impacted site. GMES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged containers of product were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both containers were staged onsite for further evaluation.

  • Description: It was reported a one-quart release of UN1133 "Black-Out RTU" arrived damaged at Terminal LSL. The terminal stated that (1) a one-gallon plastic pail was punctured by other freight during transit after falling from its pallet due to not being properly secured impacting the trailer. The SDS was reviewed with the caller who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 55-gallon poly drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, the damaged metal pail, the remaining product, and issued PPE was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023120474
item.description:
Report E-2023120474

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-03T15:12:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 15, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN1789 was damaged and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Compliance Technologies (ACT) to remediate the impacted site. ACT personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the sulfuric acid-impacted impacted trailer floor and soil under the trailer. Crews tightened the bung and the leak stopped. Crews secured the drum upright to the trailer wall and the driver continued on to the terminal. Utilizing hand tools, the ACT crew was able to excavate the impacted soil. All impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was taken by ACT.

item.title: Report X-2023120592
item.description:
Report X-2023120592

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-03T15:12:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: MAUMEE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOADER NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR OF LEAKING PACKAGE. SUPERVISOR CALLED IT OUT ON THE RADIO. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ALONG WITH THE RMP RESPONDED TO PD 11 DOOR 151 GRATES AND FOUND THE LEAKING PACKAGE. AFTER SEEING WHAT THE PACKAGE WAS AND TYPE OF HAZMAT, IT WAS PLACED IN A LINED SPILL TRY WITH ZEP ABSORBENT. ZEP ABSORBENT WAS THEN USED TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL THAT WAS ON THE FLOOR UNDER THE GRATES. THE GRATES WERE NOT LEAKED ON. THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO PSC AREA TO BE PROCESSED. CHROMEX BINDER A WAS THE LEAKING BOTTLE. THE LID WAS FOUND TO BE OFF WITH NO SEAL. THIS WAS ABSORBED USING ZEP ABSORBANT. CHROMEX BINDER B WAS FIRST NEUTROLIZED USING SODIUM BICARB, THEN WAS ABSORBED USING ZEP ABSORBENT. BOTH DESIGNATED RESPONDER AND RMP WORE THE CORRECT PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT.

  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=774200642190 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1268 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=PETROLEUM DISTILLATES, N.O.S. PKG GRP=II SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=1.1 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=1.1 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=774200642190 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1593 CLASS=61 PSN TEXT=DICHLOROMETHANE PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=0.004 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=B - Glass# porcelain# or stoneware NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=0.004 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=774200642190 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1760 CLASS=80 PSN TEXT=CORROSIVE LIQUID, N.O.S. PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=300 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Milliliter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=B - Glass# porcelain# or stoneware NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=300 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )A fiberboard box with signs of release was found during sort operations at the MEMH facility. While investigating the shipment there were three glass bottles of petroleum distillates that had broken and spilled inside of the fiberboard box. All items inside were wrapped with bubble wrap and the inside of the fiberboard box was lined with plastic. The remaining contents were contained into a Steel Salvage Package. The shipper has been contacted for an amended Declaration and further disposition.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At 4:56 am at door 10 in the unload PH called out to management that there was a leaking hazmat package. Manager addressed the issue quickly by grabbing gloves, apron and hazmat spill bin. Grabbed 3 hazmat package out the back of trailer #836334 from FTWO that were affected by the one leaking hazmat. Took the bin over to QA to separate corrosive spill from explosive hazmat. DescribePack: Hazmat package failure was a corrosive package that was laid inappropriately on his side instead up right by the orientation arrows. Another identical hazmat package was also inappropriately laid on its side on top of the leaking hazmat. Bottom hazmat was crushed by the pressure and had a failed lid closure due to weight and being laid inappropriately and unsafely in back of the trailer. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in hazmat bin immediately upon discovery. Loose lid was also tightened.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was picked up from a driver on the day of 12/14/23 and brought back to the station. Upon arrival of QA Calvin Pudela (12/15/23 @ 12:00PM), a noticeable odor of alcohol was coming from the pail. Upon further investigation of the HAZMAT Pail, I covered the opening with tape so I could test if the seal was actually broken or not. Once I flipped the pail over, I noticed that there was a slight amount of liquid coming out. Then I started my processing of HAZMAT package. DescribePack: There is a cap built into the top cap for the pail of denatured alcohol. The cap appears to have been opened and no longer seems to close/seal. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: I taped the cap of the pail opening to avoid anymore of the smell escaping.

DAMAGE INSPECTION; LEAKED NON-REGULATED PRODUCT; NO LEAK TO AEROSOLS SUBMITTING THIS PACKAGE INTO THE ETT SYSTEM AND AWAITING INSTRUCTIONS ON PROPER DISPOSITION OF THIS PACKAGE.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSL experienced a UN1993 WCW6400 Combination Product release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to complete cleanup and a liquid tote transfer. Contractors arrived onsite and liaised with onsite LSP contact, Jay Hardy. Crew confirmed approximately 1.5-ounces of product released to the tote lid only which was padded up with an absorbent pad. The release was caused by a crack to the top corner of the tote as a result of improper loading. The product was then transferred via pump, at the requested of the LSP, into a new tote for shipment on. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbent pads and PPE into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NAT experienced a UN1760 Astro Clean ACP-10 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 10’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents and pH down were then deployed to neutralize and clean the release. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On December 22, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printer ink was punctured by a nail and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed absorbents to the ink-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket. Crews placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023120438
item.description:
Report E-2023120438

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: BARRY
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DYNO NOBEL TRANSPORTATION, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 11/30/2023, 45,660 pounds of Ammonium Nitrate Emulsion (ANE) was loaded into trailer 974 through the rearmost hatch. After loading was completed, the rear hatch was not closed and latched by the loader. On 12/1/2023, the driver coupled to the trailer and departed Barry, IL and drove to Buckley Powder Company in Hermann, MO. The driver arrived, unloaded into the product tower, and traveled back in reverse order on the same route. The trailer was uncoupled Barry, IL. Employees at site observed ANE residue on the side of the trailer. Buckley Powder Company found spots of ANE residue on their private gravel road totaling less than ten (10) pounds, which they cleaned up and disposed of properly. It is estimated 5,247 pounds of ANE was lost in transit between Barry, IL and Hermann, MO. It was raining on 12/1/2023. Dyno Nobel employees inspected the roadways of IL 106 and US 54 and there was not any evidence of residue on the roadway. The Buckley Powder manager inspected Loutre Bend Rd and did not observe residue on the road.

  • Description: 1. X-2023120935 SequenceEvent: A driver noticed that the package was leaking. That driver placed the package in front of the hazmat cage in a damage hazmat tote. I moved the tote, to the damaged hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Loose caps and a poor-quality seam on one of the bottles caused the package to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I placed the package in the Damaged hazmat cage, to prevent further damage. 2. X-2023120936 SequenceEvent: A driver placed this package in a damaged hazmat tote on top of another hazmat. I separated the packages from each other on entry into the damaged hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Poor seam quality led to one of the three bottles leaking from the top. item.title: Report X-2023120993
item.description:
Report X-2023120993

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120993 SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with wet conditions and closures open. Upon inspection, 2 of 4 were found with internal leakage due to loose caps and the remaining 2 were missing not found. The package was placed into a salvage drum to await disposition. DescribePack: The package failure seems to be from loose caps causing internal leakage and causing the box to become wet and closures to open and the remaining two bottles to come out of the box and go missing. 2 of the 3 bottles that leaked out, leaked out about a cup each. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately inspected and recovered items were placed into a salvage drum. 2. X-2023120994 SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with wet conditions and closures open. Upon inspection, 4 Bottles were found 1 with a missing cap. The bottles in the package weren't all the corresponding ones with this package. This package is to contain 2 Part A Bottles & 2 Part B bottles, all bottles that arrived with the box at the cage were all Part B bottles. The Part A bottles are missing and were replaced with wrong bottles. DescribePack: The package failure was due to loose and missing caps causing leakage and allowing the box to get wet and break open and 2 bottles to go missing. The bottles that were recovered which mentioned weren't all the correct bottles as mentioned all leaked out almost 2 cups each. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bottles cap were secured and the bottle with no cap was placed upright into a salvage drum to await disposition.

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: GROVELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12/15/2023 at approximately 1345 , Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 68727 at the station location in Groveland, reporting a herbicide spill. The shipment consisted of one plastic container that shipped inside of a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered leaking, initially the cause was unknown. The shipment was discovered leaking during delivery and was returned to the station, Further investigation revealed that the top was not secure on the bottle, causing the spillage. An online safety data sheet was located by Dangerous Goods Administration and it revealed that the commodity was classified as a regulated corrosive shipment, though not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held pending an FAA investigation.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLR experienced an over the road release of NA1993 Spec-Aid* 8Q123ULS from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of product released to a 1’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to a crack in the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed to clean the impacted area. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was removed from site pending disposal.

  • Description: DURING PACKAGE X-RAY AT THE UPS FACILITY IN DUBAI, UNITED ARAB EMIRATES, ONE PACKAGE WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN THIRTEEN LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. DIRECTLY WRITTEN ON EACH BATTERY IS AN INDICATION THE BATTERIES ARE FAILING IN SOME WAY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE LITHIUM ION BATTERIES ALONE ARE BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK TO CHINA. THERMAL TRACKING LABEL AND INVOICE DECLARE THE INNER CONTENTS AS SCOOTER PARTS. THE BATTERIES ARE SHIPPING ALONE INSIDE THE BOX. NO ADDITIONAL SCOOTER PARTS. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM INDIANA USING UPS ACCOUNT X865V0, BCO LAB, 3431 WILLIAM RICHARDSON DR, #600, SOUTH BEND INDIANA 46628.

Also bottles had loose caps which caused liquid to leak inside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Certified person was called to move hazmat out of trailer; and place into red hazardous tote to be moved to hazmat cage for inspection. Also proper eye and wear gear were used in the clean up process.

  • Description: On 12/18/23, the TILX 200118 was found to be leaking from the top housing of the car. Hazmat responders isolated the car in track 44 and found liquid Nitric Acid to be leaking from the liquid line cap. Inspection revealed that the cap was missing a gasket and the valve was partially open. The valve was closed stopping the release and a new gasket installed. HMR cleaned and neutralized spilled acid and containerized ground impacts for proper disposal.

  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 14, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote containing UN1805 had a loose cap during transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE deployed a neutralizer to the tote and the trailer floor. The crew utilized a fork lift to elevate the impacted tote and gravity transfer the material into a new tote. FCE deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer. The crew utilized hand tools to collect the neutralizer and absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 13, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1760 was crushed in transit and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel successfully transferred the contents from the damaged 330-gallon tote to a new 330-gallon tote for further shipment and processing. Crews utilized hand tools to cut up the damaged tote for waste, and they utilized a neutralizing solution and absorbent pads to remediate the impacted dock floor. Four (4) 55-gallon drums containing the cut-up tote, spent absorbent pads, damaged metal fittings, and impacted cardboard were generated as waste and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Description: AT THE LONDON HUB UPS FACILITY IN THE UNITED KINGDOM, A DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY IN THE USA WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING. 4 X 1 GALLON CONTAINERS WERE FOUND INSIDE THE UN SPECIFICATION PACKAGE. ALL FOUR CONTAINERS WERE PACKAGED CONTRARY TO THE ORIENTATION ARROWS DEPICTED ON THE OUTER UN SPECIFICATION BOX. TWO OF THE CONTAINERS INSIDE THE PACKAGE WERE NOT ENCLOSED IN POLY BAGS AND WERE LEAKING FROM THEIR CLOSURES. PRIOR TO THE DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS FLIGHTS FROM OAK TO SDF, SD TO PHL, AND PHL TO STN. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT 1FE015, THE PERFUMER'S APPRENTICE, 170 TECHNOLOGY CIRCLE, SCOTTS VALLEY CA 95066.

Top of the drum got dented and plastic plug closure seems to be slightly displaced causing leakage through there as well. The drum was placed into a salvage drum to collect any further possible leakage and to await disposition. DescribePack: The package failure seems to be from the metail pail receiving impacts from being improperly packaged for shipping. Drum has soiled stains from the product throughout the entire drum coming from the lid down. Plastic Plug top seems to be slightly displaced causing leakage from there too. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately inspected & the drum was placed upright into a lined salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2023120385
item.description:
Report E-2023120385

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: KAUKAUNA
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: • We had weather issues right out of the gate with freezing. Product freezes at 50-52 degrees • Initially when he opened the trailer and customer valves (internal and external) nothing was flowing. • Stopped, shut compressor off, closed the airline and internal and external. Bled the pressure off the line. No pressure was on the line or product. Used 50 foot airline and blew heat on the QRB to warm it up. Gave up on that. The customer had steam so they heated the valve. Got product flowing. • He had 2 hoses to make delivery. He had a wall to his right side and the back of the truck. As such the first hose had to loop around to get it under the trailer to the wall where there was a 6” hole where part of his second hose went through the wall and connected to the customer fill line 3-4 feet inside. After the fill line hook up there is a shut off valve roughly 8” after that. The fill line then goes vertical to the ceiling and then over and in to the tank. • The product (Bevrosheen) was very slushy. This was tied to compartment 3. • At the end of the offload he saw the hose rise up and could feel the hose was light. • He shut down and then cracked his external open and walked the line to the customer tank and shut their fill line and the internal and external valves on the trailer. • At this point he went to bleed the pressure off the hoses but the chicago cap for the bleeder valve was froze on. He used a screw driver to break it free. He then lifted his pale up to the bleeder valve and opened it ¼ of the way and nothing came out. He continued to open it more and nothing came out. Both he and the unloader knew that it must be blocked with frozen product. With the bleeder valve closed now he used a screw driver to get it clear of frozen product. It then depressurized as expected when he opened the valve. He commented that the amount of time it took to depressurize was consistent with how long it normally takes. The process to get the bleeder valve clear from frozen product took roughly 3-5 minutes which is noteworthy as this was time the hoses with product inside were sitting idle in the cold weather • Richard was able to safely disconnect the hose (ie – any pressure in the hose in theory is clearly gone at this point) and reducer fitting from the trailer and then capped off the reducer fitting. He kept the reducer fitting on that end of the hose attached as the unloader was going to take the reducer and two hoses and rinse them out together for our driver. When the unloader got the one end of the hose with the reducer fitting on it near the wash station he laid it down and uncapped it again (again no pressure coming out of it). Our driver now moved to the customer fill line and he loosened the camlock (right side) furthest away from him first and then the left side closest too him (following protocol) which is when the hose blew off of the fill line down towards the ground with a line of product shooting up at him.

item.title: Report I-2023120016
item.description:
Report I-2023120016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: WORCESTER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PROSPECT TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 3
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This incident was the result of a three (3) vehicle crash. Vehicle 1 was an auto which stopped in the right lane of the travel portion of the 70 MPH roadway blocking the right travel lane of the roadway. Vehicle 2 a truck stopped directly behind the auto or was in the process of coming to a halt to render assistance. Vehicle 3 consisting of a truck-tractor semi-trailer cargo tank in the right lane was unable to stop and made contact with vehicle 2 which made contact with vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 fuel tank exploded causing flames to engulf both vehicle 2 and the truck-tractor of vehicle 3. It appears that materials being transported in vehicle 2, including cylinders, exploded adding to the fire. Heat from the flames caused the Jet Fuel to build pressure causing release of the PRV and those vapors lit adding to the heat factor. Heat caused the right top portion of the cargo tank to melt releasing product onto the roadway which lit. Fire response units used foam to extinguish the tanker portion of the fire and water to handle the tire portion. Driver in Vehicle 3 along with driver and passenger in vehicle 2 died as a result of the flames. Driver Vehicle 1 was cited by PA State Police for causing the crash and issued several citations.

item.title: Report X-2023110335
item.description:
Report X-2023110335

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: KLAMATH FALLS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: USE personnel opened the protective housing and inspected the valves and fittings. The liquid line valve closure plug was found to be leaking. The liquid line valve was in the closed position. USE personnel utilized hand tools to tighten the liquid line valve closure plug but found that it was already tool tight. The closure plug was then removed for further inspection. There were no leaks identified with the closure plug removed. USE personnel then applied thread tape to the closure plug, reinstalled, and tightened the closure plug to tool tight. USE personnel inspected the closure plug and found that there were no further leaks present. Upon completion, USE personnel closed and secured the protective housing with custody seal 249224. Integrity of the valve was inspected by placing a pressure gauge on the liquid line and monitoring over a period f a few hours. No LPG was found to be leaking past the closed valve.

item.title: Report I-2023090105
item.description:
Report I-2023090105

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-31T00:35:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HERITAGE TRANSPORT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While driving a loaded trailer, a driver hit the brakes to avoid a vehicle collision. The container load shifted forward and a 55DF of Chromic Acid sludge was damaged. The contents of the drum leaked from the bottom and sides of the trailer floor onto the roadway and plant parking lot surface. Stormwater collected on the KC Plant parking lot was impacted by the spill.

item.title: Report I-2023090143
item.description:
Report I-2023090143

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-31T00:35:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: Hounslow
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Delta received notification on 08/18/23 of an undeclared event where 35 pieces out of 57 said to contain personal home goods was received at LHR (DL030-16AUG ATL-LHR). The shipment was screened by K9 at origin (LAX). Upon arrival in LAX, the shipment was being re-screened by x-ray for onward transfer to Lagos. Multiple packages were found to contain undeclared dangerous goods: -UN3481 Lithium-Ion Battery Contained In Equipment, -UN3481 Lithium Ion Battery Packed With Equipment, -UN1950 Aerosols, Flammable -UN1266 Perfumery Products. . Flight#: DL030 Date: 08/16/2023 AWB:006-76026532 The event is under investigation to determine root cause and subsequent corrective actions. See the attached pictures.

item.title: Report I-2023090117
item.description:
Report I-2023090117

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-31T00:35:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: JEFFERSONVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Univar Solutions USA Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver arrived at customer to fill a sulfuric tank. He verified the tank, quantity, product, and connections before starting to pump. The driver started the pump and after a couple of minutes he noticed sulfuric acid leaking out of the pump box. The driver immediately shut it down and notified his supervisor. The customer blocked off the nearest sewer drain with boom and absorbent. A third party cleanup contractor was sent in to neutralize and remove the product that was released. The cause of the release was determined to be two loose nuts on the flange that connects the outbound side of the pump to the hose reel. Going forward we will be checking the torque on all nuts inside this pump box monthly.
